CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs . We have designed and synthesized two anthracene - based low band - gap copolymers , PTATDPP and PTAFDPP. Since the TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure with a weak electron - donating nature , the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band - gap , a low - lying HOMO energy level , high crystallinity , and efficient charge transporting characteristics. The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively. Furthermore , PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor ( di-PBI ) is used as an electron acceptor material for the PSC device. These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PSC (mentioned twice)
 * Definition: Polymer solar cell
2. PC71BM (mentioned once)
 * Definition: Poly[71-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester]
3. PTATDPP (mentioned twice)
 * Definition: Poly[thienyl-substituted anthracene-co-diphenylene]
4. PTAFDPP (mentioned once)
 * Definition: Poly[thienyl-substituted anthracene-co-fluorenylene]
5. DPP (mentioned once)
 * Definition: Diphenylene
6. TA (mentioned once)
 * Definition: Thienyl
7. di-PBI (mentioned once)
 * Definition: Diphenylene-based acceptor

So, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are: PSC, PC71BM, PTATDPP, PTAFDPP, DPP, TA, and di-PBI.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the relevant "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PTATDPP
2. PTAFDPP

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph as a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| PTAFDPP |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs . We have designed and synthesized two anthracene - based low band - gap copolymers , PTATDPP and PTAFDPP. Since the TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure with a weak electron - donating nature , the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band - gap , a low - lying HOMO energy level , high crystallinity , and efficient charge transporting characteristics. The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively. Furthermore , PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor ( di-PBI ) is used as an electron acceptor material for the PSC device. These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the property names of the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PSC (Photovoltaic Cell)
2. PC71BM (Polythiophene with 71% benzothienyl side chain)
3. TA (Thienyl)
4. DPP (Di-phenylene)
5. PTATDPP (Poly(thienyl-anthracene-co-di-phenylene))
6. PTAFDPP (Poly(thienyl-anthracene-co-di-fluorenylene))
7. di-PBI (Di-phenyl-benzoic acid)
8. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital)
9. LOMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital)
10. crystallinity

Note that some of these terms are used as adjectives to describe the properties of the materials, while others are used as nouns to refer to the materials themselves.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph, after removing irrelevant entities:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Cell Efficiency)
2. PSC (Photovoltaic Cell)
3. PC71BM (Polythiophene with 71% benzothienyl side chain)
4. TA (Thienyl)
5. DPP (Di-phenylene)
6. PTATDPP (Poly(thienyl-anthracene-co-di-phenylene))
7. PTAFDPP (Poly(thienyl-anthracene-co-di-fluorenylene))
8. di-PBI (Di-phenyl-benzoic acid)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid property names mentioned in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE (Photovoltaic Cell Efficiency) |
| PSC (Photovoltaic Cell) |
| PC71BM (Polythiophene with 71% benzothienyl side chain) |
| TA (Thienyl) |
| DPP (Di-phenylene) |
| PTATDPP (Poly(thienyl-anthracene-co-di-phenylene)) |
| PTAFDPP (Poly(thienyl-anthracene-co-di-fluorenylene)) |
| di-PBI (Di-phenyl-benzoic acid) |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs . We have designed and synthesized two anthracene - based low band - gap copolymers , PTATDPP and PTAFDPP. Since the TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure with a weak electron - donating nature , the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band - gap , a low - lying HOMO energy level , high crystallinity , and efficient charge transporting characteristics. The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively. Furthermore , PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor ( di-PBI ) is used as an electron acceptor material for the PSC device. These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's go through the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. VOC (Open Circuit Voltage): Not mentioned.
2. JSC (Short Circuit Current): Not mentioned.
3. FF (Fill Factor): Not mentioned.
4. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency):
 * PTATDPP: 4.23%
 * PTAFDPP: 5.22%
 * PC71BM: 7.02%
5. Band gap:
 * TA unit: Not mentioned.
 * PTATDPP: Low band gap.
 * PTAFDPP: Low band gap.
6. HOMO energy level (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital energy level):
 * TA unit: Not mentioned.
 * PTATDPP: Low - lying HOMO energy level.
 * PTAFDPP: Low - lying HOMO energy level.
7. Crystallinity:
 * PTATDPP: High crystallinity.
 * PTAFDPP: High crystallinity.
8. Charge transporting characteristics:
 * PTATDPP: Efficient charge transporting characteristics.
 * PTAFDPP: Efficient charge transporting characteristics.
9. Electron acceptor material:
 * PTATDPP: Di-PBI (a non-fullerene acceptor material).

Note that some of these values are not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph, but can be inferred from the context.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency): 4.23%, 5.22%, and 7.02%
2. HOMO energy level (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital energy level): low - lying HOMO energy level
3. Crystallinity: high crystallinity

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to the value of material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 4.23% | PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) |
| 5.22% | PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) |
| 7.02% | PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) |
| low-lying HOMO energy level | HOMO energy level (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital energy level) |
| high crystallinity | Crystallinity |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
